sub_title: MPIP-ICMS PhD candidate in Supramolecular Chemistry
summary:
Chemistry governs core aspects in life and therefore it can be exploited to improve its functions.

I am a pharmacist and I decided to continue my studies with a PhD program in the DankersLab (https://www.dankerslab.nl/) at the TU/e, in collaboration with the Max Planck Institute for Polymer Research, in order to achieve the knowledge necessary to improve the people’s quality of life in the future. With that purpose in mind, I am dealing with fundamental research on new supramolecular polymers that are expected to become a new chemical tool for biomedical applications.

Besides Science, I like to differentiate my interests also towards humanistic fields, as philosophy and art, economics and marketing, but my favorite activity during my spare time is located in the kitchen between pots and pans. Indeed I stimulate my creativity by cooking delicious dishes, some of which can be found at very.freshhh (https://instagram.com/very.freshhh?igshid=1skxnijocfbeu) on Instagram.
